task.title: Capture a Scrolling Window Screenshot
task.shortdesc: How to capture a scrolling window screenshot.

context.p: A scrolling window screenshot will capture the entire width or length of a program's interface. This type of screenshot is useful when you want to capture an entire webpage.

step.cmd: Find a webpage you want to capture.
Set the Selection type to Scrolling Window.
Set Effects and Share to None.
Toggle the Capture Cursor option off.
step.info: The toggle icon should be grey when it is turned off.

step.cmd: Toggle the Preview in Editor option on.
step.info: The toggle icon should be blue when it is turned on.

step.cmd: Click on the arrow icon at the bottom of the capture area.

taskbody.result: Snagit will scroll down the window and process the capture. Snagit Editor will display the completed capture.
taskbody.example: You are researching Google results to optimize the SEO for our user documentation. After the search results load, you capture a vertically scrolling window screenshot. Snagit processes the image and displays it in Snagit Editor. You can now refer to this screenshot when compiling data about SEO results.
